data.title: affordable christmas dinner in a posh place
data.text: we had our christmas dinner last year with my coworkers, everybody enjoyed the food, especially the Chinese Chicken salad and Pan Fried crispy noodles. although the place is small, we were accomodated in a relaxed atmosphere. affordable price

data.title: Best Chinese Cuisine in Americana
data.text: I love this place .. We always dine in whenever we visit Americana .. Food quality and taste is outstanding (specially the aromatic shrimps) .. Nice Martini .. Affordable prices .. But service is not up to the standard .. Would still recommend it

data.title: Amazing martini's, you must order one if you go here!
data.text: We expected to go for a good Chinese dinner but instead walked away with the most amazing Martini "experience".  We sat at the bar while we waited fro friends to meet the very unique and engaging bartender.  He created the entire martini menu and strongly believes in his craft, this you can tell right off the bat.  you ask him about a drink and he has a "story" that involves intense shaking and crystal formation on the top of your drink.  I kid you not when I say he will hand you a magnifying glass to see the crystals!  So bar is truly five stars.  The drinks were in fact amazing, we had three different types of martini's, the best one was the pomegranate passion fruit martini, simple amazing!  He muddles the pomegranate in your glass right in front of you!  So, on to the meal and service, a bit disappointing here, and overall three stars so average to four stars overall.  We were seated and they didn't have enough menu's so we got take-out paper versions... umm--- can I get a real menu please?!?  Sad part is, there were only two other tables that we could see using menus, total of 8 people, really-- you don't have more than 8 menus for a place that seats 40+ (my best guess)? Anyway, we asked for real menus and they trickled in, they were brought to our table one by one as other people finished using theirs!  We ordered soups and all were delicious, the egg flower drop was so light and fresh!  Wonton soup also very light and tasted excellent.  We ordered the sizzling chicken, mongolian beef, garlic shrimp, sliced fish in black bean sauce, buddha feast of veggies, friend rice and lo mein.  All was very good BUT it all tasted the same, like heavy savory Chinese food.  Why would garlic sauce, black bean sauce, mongolian beef--- everything taste the same?!  We all had trouble at the table differentiating the dishes BUT food was actually tasty and good so everything disappeared quickly!

data.title: Dinner
data.text:
We had to wait 20 minutes at the table to have a waiter take our order. The steam dumpling were cold. Chicken LoMein was just disgusting. Very salty with a smoky flavor. Shrimp Chi . The shrimp was barely cooked and the egg white sauce was very runny.
Terrible service 
Will not come back for sure

data.title: reasonable food and prices
data.text: For a quick dinner this is a good place.   The food was good and the service was also pleasant and good.

data.title: Good food - poor service
data.text: For a chain restaurant, the food was quite good.  The Chinese chicken salad had maybe a little too much dressing, but everything else really was enjoyable.  The service was not good at all.  There were only a couple of other tables of diners, though one was a large party of about 10-12 people.  The waiter was unfriendly - downright surly.  After we finished our meal, we waited about 25 minutes before finally asking the manager for the check.  Not a bad place for lunch while shopping, if you have time.

data.title: Great Chinese Food with Walk and Drive By Entertainment
data.text: I found this place while walking one evening and was not disappointed. The restaurant front was open, so I could sit facing the sidewalk and street (great people watching). I ordered the sesame chicken and fried rice, and there was enough for two. Excellent. This was my first experience with Tsingtao beer, and it complemented the meal very nicely (I was walking so I had two). The waiter was attentive and friendly. Valet parking for the Americana is in front of this restaurant, so I also enjoyed watching the luxury cars coming and going. The trolley also stops on the street in front of this restaurant for added entertainment.

data.title: Great Chinese food
data.text: While there are less-pricey restaurants, the atmosphere and quality here is worth the price...but it's not overlay priced. The Chinese Chicken Salad is SO worth it. Actually all of it is great. They make killer Mai Tais, but the original restaurant in Los Feliz makes them better. I still order them here, though.

data.title: Terrible food, great service, our last meal in LA-wish it had been nice :(
data.text:
The restaurant isn't as nice as it looks on here! There was lots of junk around. It was about 9pm when we called in for food. Hardly any customers but were hungry and love Chinese so stopped here under the pretence that as its centrally located it must be a nice eatery. Wrong! The waitress was lovely I have to say and when we placed our order she told us not to order the sizzling beef as it gets sent back all the time...we felt like we were on Ramseys kitchen nightmares. Very kind of her but as u can imagine we were concerned about the food with her saying the beef isn't very good. We wanted to leave there and then but felt like we couldn't or it would have been rude so we stayed. We ordered what we thought was chicken satay to start, it came out as a plate of cold chicken (clearly cheap meat still semi frozen) with a massive dollop of cold peanut butter ontop (looked like out of a jar) and wasn't placed presentably. I wouldn't feed that to my dog and tasted vile. Made me gag. Had to send it back. The mains were ok but not that nice. Possibly the 
worst Chinese iv had. Felt sorry for our waitress who was running around doing all the work while the manager (a lady) seemed to doing nothing. Don't bother going! I just hope the owners realise what an amazing job there waitress does. Note for the owners: its quality not quantity!

data.title: Best Chinese chicken salad!
data.text: We come here all the time for the chicken salad, it's amazing and one salad large enough for 2 people.  Hot and sour soup is excellent also.  We usually come for a soup and salad lunch.  Free valet parking right in front of the place, very convenient.

data.title: It wasn't our first choice...
data.text: We went to Glendale to see my nephew play in the orchestra at the Alex Theatre, and needed to have dinner prior to the performance. We had decided to go to the Cheesecake Factory. Well, the wait was 45 minutes, and we didn't have time; so we found this place at the mall. We were very happy that we ended up here. We were also celebrating my sister's birthday. We all ordered something different and everyone pretty much loved what they ate. Some comments - Mongolian beef was good, but have had better. Kung Pao Chicken was the best I've ever had. Shrimp a la Chi was not the flavor I had expected, but it was delicious! Hubby had the wonton soup, and it was very good, I helped him with it! My father had the Orange Chicken, and he loved it - he even stopped the waiter to let him know how good it was. Service was expedient and friendly. The waiter didn't try to rush us through our meal. He even brought ice cream for my sister for dessert and sang Happy Birthday. Our water, iced tea and soda glasses were constantly being refilled, which was great. The atmosphere was great, you didn't have the feeling that you were in an outdoor mall. My only complaint is that you have to buy your rice separately. I don't think I've been to a chinese place where you had to buy it separately.

data.title: Nice staff, ok food
data.text: The best in this place was a waiter, he was very charming. But the food was just ok ( usually chinese food is delicious).

data.title: Great food, slow but friendly service
data.text: Chi Dynasty has a terrific atmosphere and great location in the Americana. We were kept waiting awhile when we got there. We were starving and ordered dumplings as soon as the waiter arrived. We were informed that the dumplings take an additional 15 minutes to cook. Thank Goodness they were amazing and worth the wait. All of the food was terrific, the service was just a tad slow. Be patient for good food!

data.title: Nice addition to the Americana!
data.text:
This place has a very nice ambience. Staff is relatively friendly (although hostess seemed a little "gone" in the eyes- kind of like Daria on Suburgatory) and the waiter was average.

However, the food was really good. All the dishes were good, prepared well and served attractively. Also, the prices are pretty decent for such a nice place. I would definitely come back here.

BTW, drinks on the menu are a bit overpriced so you may or may not want to imbibe.

data.title: Ramai
data.text: Saat kami berkunjung kesini memang kondisinya sedang ramai, jadi agak kurang nyaman. Tapi memang makanannya enak dan berkualitas

data.title: Excellent restaurant chinois.
data.text:
Dans ce magnifique quartier de l'Americana de Glendale, nous souhaitions dîner ce vendredi soir à nouveau au Cheesecake Factory que nous avions beaucoup apprécié. Malheureusement, il y avait une heure d'attente et nous avons préféré trouver autre chose, ce qui nous a amené vers ce restaurant.

Il y a une carte de plats très différentes de nos restaurants chinois de France, mais c'est vraiment excellent. Nous avons pris en entrée des nems aux légumes (vegetable spring rolls) que nous avons partagé, une hot and sour soup (soupe épicée un peu amère), un slizzing beef (boeuf épicé sur plaque chauffante), un mandarin beef (boeuf aux champignons et pousses de bambou), et un mongolian beef ( boeuf avec des échalotes et du gingembre). Le tout accompagné de riz blanc.

Tout était encore une fois excellent, le slizzing beef était particulièrement copieux, le reste étant ramené dans un doggy-bag.

Notre très gentil serveur avait beaucoup d'humour, il nous a bien conseillé et voyant que nous commandions trop, nous a dit que ce serait suffisant.

En revanche, les desserts ne semblaient pas extraordinaires.

Très bon restaurant, à recommander donc.

data.title: Неплохой ужин
data.text: Зашли в этот ресторан случайно. Приятная атмосфера, нормальное обслуживание. Порции достаточно большие, мы смогли осилить только половину.  Заказывая алкогольные коктейли, учитывайте, что некоторые из них очень крепкие. Ценителем китайской кухни себя не считаю, потому высказаться конкретно по качеству еды не могу, тем не менее специально искать бы это место не стала.

data.title: Comida chinesa a la carte
data.text: Apos descobrir por acaso The Americana, em Glendale, o Chi Dynasty, tambem foi uma grata surpresa. Estavamos fugindo da comida mexicana, que alias eta em todo lugar em LA. Lugar muito agradavel, com estacionamento tipo valet. Comida saborosa, farta e com preço justo, e não é fast food...
